Content.Name: 6 Music's Midnight Double Header
Content.Description: Classic live sets presented by Vic McGynn, with The Breeders at the 2002 Reading Festival, followed by Spear of Destiny with a set taken from their performance at the Kilburn National in 1987

Content.Name: Chris Hawkins
Content.Description: The very best music through the early hours

Content.Description: Kerrang! hell-raiser, Stevie Chick joins Phill and Phil to review his pick of the week's new musical releases

Content.Description: Music and chat

Content.Description: Heroes or Zeros returns for 2006, but it's been revamped and you can still win all five albums of the day from this week if you get through to Friday

Content.Description: The finest documentaries on the bands who shaped music

Content.Description: Phill Jupitus is here with the breakfast show, and talks gadgets and games with Dave Green

Content.Description: Great music and regular features including Rock Conundrum, Listener's Lottery, Good Day, Bad Day and Coffee and TV, and Rebel Playlist

Content.Description: Live guests, live sessions and the lowdown on what's happening across the entire musical spectrum

Content.Name: BBC 6 Music Plays It Again
Content.Description: Liverpool, The New Wave: Series on the rise of the Liverpool music scene post Beatles

Content.Name: Nemone's Dream Ticket
Content.Description: The Headline Set comes from The Bodysnatchers and was recorded for John Peel on 8th April 1980

Content.Description: Phill and Phil don their red coats as August Darnell, aka Kid Creole, joins us in the studio, ahead of his band's tour of the UK's premiere Butlins Holiday Resorts

Content.Name: Vic McGlynn
Content.Description: Heroes or Zeros returns, but it's been revamped and you can still win all five albums of the day from this week if you get through to Friday

Content.Name: Steve Lamacq
Content.Description: Great music and features Good Day, Bad Day, Rock Conundrum and Listener's Lottery

Content.Name: Tom Robinson's Evening Sequence
Content.Description: For live guests, sessions and the lowdown on what's happening across the entire music spectrum

Content.Name: Nemone's Dream Ticket
Content.Description: Highlighting the glories of the BBC's unique music archive

Content.Name: Phill Jupitus Breakfast Show
Content.Description: LA party queen Chris Marlowe is live on the line with news from Hollywood's film and music scene

Content.Name: Gideon Coe
Content.Description: Music and chat with Gideon

Content.Name: Steve Lamacq
Content.Description: Steve's Guests are Arctic Monkeys

Content.Name: Tom Robinson's Evening Sequence
Content.Description: For live guests, live sessions and the lowdown on what's happening across the entire musical spectrum, join Tom Robinson for The Evening Sequence

Content.Name: Nemone's Dream Ticket
Content.Description: More glories from the BBC archives, with classic sessions and live performances, including a Peel session recorded in 1982 by Animal Magic

Content.Name: Phill Jupitus Breakfast Show
Content.Description: Empire magazine's Editor-At-Large Ian Nathan returns with the latest movie news and reviews of the week's biggest releases

Content.Name: Gideon Coe
Content.Description: Music, chat and competitions with Gideon

Content.Name: Vic McGlynn
Content.Description: The Roundup news hound Julie Cullen joins Vic for a look back at the week's shenanigans in the world of entertainment

Content.Name: Steve Lamacq
Content.Description: Join Steve for the musical sprint finish to your marathon day

Content.Name: Round Table with Steve Lamacq
Content.Description: Guests including Miles Hunt of The Wonderstuff will be passing judgement on a heap of upcoming releases

Content.Name: The Music Week
Content.Description: Music journalists Mark Sutherland and Julie Cullen bring you all the week's music news, in just one hour, including a report on Belle and Sebastian's current tour

Content.Name: Craig Charles Funk Show
Content.Description: Craig has the very best in Soul, RnB, Funk, Jazz and Blues

Content.Name: 6 Mix
Content.Description: This week's 6 Mix takeover comes from Brighton's craziest kids: The Go! Team

Content.Name: Brinsley Forde's Dub Bashment
Content.Description: Brinsley Forde explores the wonderful and influential world of dub reggae

Content.Name: Clare McDonnell
Content.Description: The very best music through the early hours, plus Spotlight Act, Rewind and Morning After

Content.Name: Weekend Breakfast
Content.Description: Natasha Desborough pits four albums from a particular year against each other to find out which one is the best

Content.Name: Liz Kershaw
Content.Description: Liz will be joined by Jeff Simpson who'll be reviewing the best new movies

Content.Name: Marc Riley's Rocket Science
Content.Description: Marc's Rocket Science brings you three hours of tutorials, tests, and top tunes! Includes 2 Minute Hero and a session from the archives

Content.Name: The 6 Music Chart
Content.Description: Find out who makes the 6 Music Chart this week as we count down the Top 40

Content.Name: The Craig Charles Funk Show
Content.Description: Craig Charles pumps the funk up for this Saturday night

Content.Name: Bruce Dickinson's Rock Show
Content.Description: Bruce Dickinson brings you a mixture of classic rock, metal and the best new rock music

Content.Name: Natasha Desborough
Content.Description: Natasha wants to find the best of album of 1990 and Depeche Mode's Violator goes head to head with the Sundays' Reading, Writing and Arithmetic

Content.Name: Liz Kershaw
Content.Description: Identify the Ruff Riff to win more prizes

Content.Description: Comedian Richard Herring is in to look over the Sunday papers

Content.Description: Stuart brings forth a selection ranging from the strange to the beautiful, via the downright plain weird

Content.Name: 6 Mix
Content.Description: This week's 6 Mix comes from award-winning Radio 1 DJ, Nihal Arthanayake

Content.Name: Marc Riley's Mint
Content.Description: Check out who'll win Mission Impossible, Uncut's Rob Hughes or Marc himself
